IDUKKI

Idukki

is a district in the south-western part of Kerala that offers a variety of attractions for tourists. It is known for its natural beauty, historical heritage, and cultural diversity. Here are some of the tourist attractions in Idukki district that you can visit:

Idukki Wildlife Sanctuary

This is a wildlife sanctuary that covers an area of 77 sq km, and is home to various species of animals, birds, and plants. You can spot elephants, bison, deer, wild dogs, jungle cats, Malabar giant squirrels, and tigers, as well as cobra, viper, krait, and many other reptiles. You can also see Malabar grey hornbills, purple sunbirds, golden orioles, and black bulbuls, among other birds. The sanctuary is surrounded by the Idukki Lake, which adds to its scenic beauty

Munnar

This is one of the most popular hill stations in Kerala, and a paradise for nature lovers. It is situated at an altitude of 1600 meters above sea level, and has a pleasant climate throughout the year. It is famous for its tea plantations, which cover the hills in a green carpet. You can also visit the Eravikulam National Park, which is home to the endangered Nilgiri Tahr, as well as the Anamudi Peak, which is the highest peak in South India. You can also enjoy the view of the Mattupetty Dam, the Echo Point, the Kundala Lake, and the Attukad Waterfalls

Thekkady

This is another famous tourist destination in Idukki district, and the location of the Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary. The sanctuary is one of the largest and most diverse in India, and hosts a variety of animals, such as elephants, tigers, leopards, wild boars, sambar, gaur, and langurs. You can also see over 300 species of birds, such as kingfishers, hornbills, woodpeckers, and barbets. You can enjoy a boat ride on the Periyar Lake, which is situated within the sanctuary, or go for a jungle safari, a bamboo rafting, or a spice plantation tour

Vagamon

This is a hill station and a summer resort, located at an altitude of 1100 meters above sea level. It is a place of tranquility and serenity, with lush green meadows, pine forests, waterfalls, and misty valleys. You can also visit the Kurisumala Ashram, a Christian monastery that follows the Indian traditions of meditation and yoga. You can also indulge in some adventure activities, such as paragliding, trekking, and rock climbing
